的.detailed_explanation: Indicates possession, akin to ‘s in English, often used to form attributive adjectives, emphasizing characteristics.
的.example_sentences: 这是我的书 (Zhè shì wǒ de shū) — This is my book.

一.detailed_explanation: The most basic numeral, used both alone and in compound numbers. It acts as an indefinite article.
一.example_sentences: 我买了一本书 (Wǒ mǎi le yī běn shū) — I bought a book.

是.detailed_explanation: Primary copula, linking the subject with predicates; essential for forming sentences.
是.example_sentences: 他是学生 (Tā shì xuéshēng) — He is a student.

不.detailed_explanation: Main adverb of negation, used to negate verbs and adjectives.
不.example_sentences: 我不喜欢 (Wǒ bù xǐhuān) — I don’t like it.

了.detailed_explanation: Signifies completed actions or changes in state.
了.example_sentences: 我吃了 (Wǒ chī le) — I have eaten.

在.example_sentences: 我在家 (Wǒ zài jiā) — I am at home.

人.detailed_explanation: Denotes human beings, fundamental in social contexts.
人.example_sentences: 那个人很好 (Nà ge rén hěn hǎo) — That person is good.

有.example_sentences: 我有时间 (Wǒ yǒu shíjiān) — I have time.

我.example_sentences: 我能做这个 (Wǒ néng zuò zhè ge) — I can do this.

他.example_sentences: 他去学校了 (Tā qù xuéxiào le) — He went to school.

这.example_sentences: 这是什么？(Zhè shì shénme?) — What is this?

个.example_sentences: 一个苹果 (Yī gè píngguǒ) — One apple.

们.example_sentences: 我们都在这里 (Wǒmen dōu zài zhèlǐ) — We are all here.

来.detailed_explanation: Indicates motion towards the speaker or a specified place.
来.example_sentences: 你来吗？(Nǐ lái ma?) — Are you coming?

上.detailed_explanation: Used to describe position or direction.

为.example_sentences: 为什么？(Wèi shénme?) — Why? (For what reason?)

和.example_sentences: 我和你 (Wǒ hé nǐ) — Me and you.

国.detailed_explanation: Refers to a country or nation.

子.detailed_explanation: A common suffix in classical and modern Chinese, used to form nouns and often reflects diminution or endearment.
子.example_sentences: 小子，过来 (Xiǎo zǐ, guòlái) — Kid, come here.

你.detailed_explanation: The standard second-person singular pronoun, essential in direct address and interpersonal communication.
你.example_sentences: 你好吗？(Nǐ hǎo ma?) — How are you?

地.meaning: earth, ground, soil, place, position, distance
地.detailed_explanation: Beyond its literal meaning, ‘地’ functions grammatically to form adverbs when paired with adjectives.
地.example_sentences: 他快乐地笑了 (Tā kuàilè de xiào le) — He laughed happily.

出.meaning: go out, come out, in direction out from something
出.detailed_explanation: Indicates motion outward or emergence, often used metaphorically to describe the start of an action.

道.detailed_explanation: ‘道’ encapsulates a path or method but is profoundly known for its philosophical connotations in Taoism.
道.example_sentences: 道可道，非常道 (Dào kě dào, fēi cháng dào) — The way that can be told is not the eternal way.

也.detailed_explanation: A simple adverb of addition, ‘也’ connects clauses and ideas, indicating agreement or similarity.
也.example_sentences: 我也是 (Wǒ yě shì) — Me too.

时.detailed_explanation: Refers to time or season, crucial in historical and contextual descriptions.
时.example_sentences: 那时，我在北京 (Nà shí, wǒ zài Běijīng) — At that time, I was in Beijing.

年.detailed_explanation: ‘年’ marks divisions of time, central to describing ages, historical periods, or experiences.
年.example_sentences: 今年是2024年 (Jīnnián shì èr líng èr sì nián) — This year is 2024.

得.meaning: verb particle, used to form a complementary result
得.detailed_explanation: Structurally, ‘得’ allows for the elaboration on the result or manner of an action.
得.example_sentences: 他跑得很快 (Tā pǎo de hěn kuài) — He runs fast.

就.detailed_explanation: Conveys immediacy or inevitability, often suggesting a conclusion or a transition based on context.
就.example_sentences: 我就去 (Wǒ jiù qù) — I’ll go right away.

那.detailed_explanation: ‘那’ functions as a demonstrative adjective or pronoun, indicating objects or ideas further from the speaker.
那.example_sentences: 看那边！(Kàn nà biān!) — Look over there!

要.meaning: want, will, shall, need, important, essential
要.detailed_explanation: Versatile, indicating desire, necessity, or future action.
要.example_sentences: 我要走了 (Wǒ yào zǒu le) — I am going to leave.

下.detailed_explanation: Describes relative position or sequential action.
下.example_sentences: 往下看 (Wǎng xià kàn) — Look down.

以.meaning: use, take, according to, because of, in order to
以.detailed_explanation: ‘以’ indicates causation or means, used to express reason or method.
以.example_sentences: 以人为本 (Yǐ rén wéi běn) — People-oriented.

生.detailed_explanation: Represents life or birth, both in biological and metaphorical senses.

会.meaning: can, able, meet, meeting, society, union, party
会.detailed_explanation: Polysemous, meaning ability, possibility, or a gathering.
会.example_sentences: 我们会见面的 (Wǒmen huì jiànmiàn de) — We will meet.

自.example_sentences: 自由自在 (Zìyóu zìzài) — Free and easy.

着.meaning: verb particle marking a continuing progress/state
着.detailed_explanation: A non-finite marker indicating ongoing action or state.
着.example_sentences: 雨下着 (Yǔ xià zhe) — It is raining.

去.detailed_explanation: Commonly used to indicate movement away from the speaker’s location.
去.example_sentences: 我明天去北京 (Wǒ míngtiān qù Běijīng) — I am going to Beijing tomorrow.

之.detailed_explanation: Classical Chinese grammatical particle, often seen in formal or literary contexts.
之.example_sentences: 山之高 (Shān zhī gāo) — The mountain’s height.

过.detailed_explanation: Marks experiences or actions that have been completed in the past.
过.example_sentences: 我去过中国两次 (Wǒ qùguò Zhōngguó liǎng cì) — I have been to China twice.

家.detailed_explanation: Centers on concepts of family and dwelling.
家.example_sentences: 我家在哪里？(Wǒ jiā zài nǎlǐ?) — Where is my home?

学.example_sentences: 他在学习中文 (Tā zài xuéxí Zhōngwén) — He is studying Chinese.

对.meaning: correct, answer, treat, agree, mutual, pair
对.detailed_explanation: Used to indicate correctness or an affirmative response.
对.example_sentences: 你的回答很对 (Nǐ de huídá hěn duì) — Your answer is correct.

可.detailed_explanation: Modifies verbs to indicate possibility or permission.
可.example_sentences: 这可不行！(Zhè kě bù xíng!) — This won’t do!

她.example_sentences: 她是我的朋友 (Tā shì wǒ de péngyǒu) — She is my friend.

里.detailed_explanation: Also used as a general locative particle meaning ‘inside’ or ‘within’.
里.example_sentences: 在房间里 (Zài fángjiān lǐ) — Inside the room.

后.detailed_explanation: Refers to spatial or temporal sequences.
后.example_sentences: 站在我后面 (Zhàn zài wǒ hòumiàn) — Stand behind me.

小.detailed_explanation: Describes size or age, often used to indicate something lesser or younger.

么.detailed_explanation: Used at the end of questions.

心.detailed_explanation: Symbolically represents emotions or the essence of thought.

多.detailed_explanation: Quantitative adverb used to express a large amount or degree.
多.example_sentences: 多美丽啊！(Duō měilì a!) — How beautiful!

天.detailed_explanation: Used both literally and figuratively, relating to the natural world and the divine.
天.example_sentences: 天气很好 (Tiānqì hěn hǎo) — The weather is good.

而.detailed_explanation: A conjunction used to connect clauses, indicating a progression or addition in thought.
而.example_sentences: 智而不说 (Zhì ér bù shuō) — Wise but silent.

能.example_sentences: 我能帮忙 (Wǒ néng bāngmáng) — I can help.

好.detailed_explanation: Qualitative adjective that also functions as an adverb in certain contexts.

都.detailed_explanation: An inclusive adverb used to generalize statements.
都.example_sentences: 我们都累了 (Wǒmen dōu lèi le) — We are all tired.

然.detailed_explanation: Often used in compound adverbs ending in ‘-ly’.

没.detailed_explanation: Used to negate the existence or occurrence of something in the past.
没.example_sentences: 我没去过那里 (Wǒ méi qù guò nàlǐ) — I have never been there.

日.detailed_explanation: Represents the sun, used to mark days or in terms related to the sun.

于.meaning: in, at, for, to, from, by, than
于.detailed_explanation: A preposition used in formal or literary contexts to indicate relation or comparison.
于.example_sentences: 幸福于我 (Xìngfú yú wǒ) — Happiness to me.

起.detailed_explanation: Indicates the beginning of an action or movement.

还.detailed_explanation: Used to indicate continuation or an additional element.
还.example_sentences: 还有问题吗？(Hái yǒu wèntí ma?) — Are there any more questions?

发.meaning: deliver, utter, express, shoot, emit, develop, expand
发.detailed_explanation: Covers a wide range of actions related to starting or releasing.

成.meaning: (=成为 chéngwéi) become; 成功 chénggōng succeed; 完成 wánchéng accomplish, complete
成.detailed_explanation: Indicates the completion or success of a process.
成.example_sentences: 成功了！(Chénggōng le!) — It’s a success!

事.meaning: matter, affair, thing, event, accident, job, responsibility
事.detailed_explanation: Refers to events, tasks, or responsibilities.
事.example_sentences: 处理事情 (Chǔlǐ shìqíng) — Handle matters.

只.detailed_explanation: Used to limit the scope or degree of an action.
只.example_sentences: 只要努力 (Zhǐ yào nǔlì) — Just need to work hard.

作.detailed_explanation: Refers to the action of doing or making something.
作.example_sentences: 作决定 (Zuò juédìng) — Make a decision.

当.detailed_explanation: Used to indicate a role or function someone or something fulfills.
当.example_sentences: 当领导 (Dāng lǐngdǎo) — Serve as a leader.

想.detailed_explanation: Covers a range of mental processes from thinking to wanting.
想.example_sentences: 我想你 (Wǒ xiǎng nǐ) — I miss you.

看.detailed_explanation: Used for visual perception or consideration.
看.example_sentences: 看问题 (Kàn wèntí) — Look at the issue.

文.detailed_explanation: Relates to text, language, or culture.

无.detailed_explanation: Denotes absence or lack of something.

开.detailed_explanation: Refers to the action of opening or beginning something.

手.meaning: hand, a person skilled in something
手.detailed_explanation: Can refer to the physical hand or someone’s skill or control.

十.detailed_explanation: The numeral for ten, fundamental in counting and numerical systems.

用.detailed_explanation: Describes the action of using something.

主.detailed_explanation: Indicates a person with control or authority.

行.detailed_explanation: Used to express feasibility or permission, also means to walk or travel.
行.example_sentences: 可以行 (Kěyǐ xíng) — It can work.

方.detailed_explanation: Refers to direction or aspect, also used as a measure word for square objects.

又.detailed_explanation: Used to indicate repetition or simultaneity in actions.
又.example_sentences: 又大又圆 (Yòu dà yòu yuán) — Both big and round.

如.detailed_explanation: Used for making comparisons or hypothetical statements.
如.example_sentences: 如此美丽 (Rúcǐ měilì) — So beautiful.

前.meaning: in front, previous, ago, former, first
前.detailed_explanation: Indicates position in space or time, often used in historical or sequential contexts.

所.detailed_explanation: Used to form nominal expressions indicating place or that which is possessed.
所.example_sentences: 所见所闻 (Suǒ jiàn suǒ wén) — What one sees and hears.

本.meaning: basis, origin, edition classifier for books, periodicals, files, etc.
本.detailed_explanation: Refers to the foundation or base of something, also used as a classifier for books.

见.meaning: appear to be, meet with, call on
见.detailed_explanation: Used to describe the act of seeing or meeting, often in formal contexts.

经.meaning: longitude (both geographic and in Chinese medicine), scripture, constant, regular, deal with
经.detailed_explanation: Refers to passing through or enduring, also used for scriptures or classic works.

头.detailed_explanation: Indicates the top or beginning of something.

面.detailed_explanation: Refers to the face of a person or object, or a flat surface.
面.example_sentences: 面对面 (Miàn duì miàn) — Face to face.

公.detailed_explanation: Used to describe things pertaining to the public or official matters.
公.example_sentences: 公共场所 (Gōnggòng chǎngsuǒ) — Public place.

同.detailed_explanation: Used to indicate sameness or being together.

三.detailed_explanation: The numeral three, used extensively in counting and categorizing.

已.detailed_explanation: Indicates completion or a past state.

老.detailed_explanation: Refers to age or the state of being old, often used respectfully.

从.detailed_explanation: Indicates origin, movement from a place, or following.
从.example_sentences: 从这里到那里 (Cóng zhèlǐ dào nàlǐ) — From here to there.

动.detailed_explanation: Describes any form of movement or change.

两.detailed_explanation: Used as a numeral before measure words, indicating the number two.
两.example_sentences: 两个人 (Liǎng gè rén) — Two people.

长.detailed_explanation: Describes length or duration, also used as an adjective to indicate something is long.
